adjective.description: Having great power, influence, or effect.
examples: thrones were potent symbols of authority

adjective.description: (of a male) able to achieve an erection or to reach an orgasm.

noun.description: Fur resembling vair, but with the alternating pieces T-shaped.

origin: Late Middle English (denoting a crutch): alteration of Old French potence crutch, from Latin potentia power (in medieval Latin crutch), from potent- (see potent).
